item.title: AFsane add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human faceâ€”for ever." -- George Orwell

item.title: AFsane add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The choice for mankind lies between freedom and happiness and for the great bulk of mankind, happiness is better." -- George Orwell

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Wilhelm Stekel
item.description: "The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that is wants to live humbly for one." -- Wilhelm Stekel

item.title: AFsane add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "When you're dead, they really fix you up. I hope to hell when I do die somebody has sense enough to just dump me in the river or something. Anything except sticking me in a goddam cemetery. People coming and putting a bunch of flowers on your stomach on Sunday, and all that crap. Who wants flowers when you're dead? Nobody." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: AFsane add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of not having the courage to be an absolute nobody." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: AFsane add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: AFsane add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description:
"Well. He's a very sensitive boy. He's really never been a terribly good mixer with other boys...'
Sensitive. That killed me. That guy Morrow was about as sensitive as a goddamn toilet seat." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: AFsane add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "A fall from the third floor hurts as much as a fall from the hundredth. If I have to fall, may it be from a high place." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: AFsane add a quote by J.K. Rowling
AFsane add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I talk to God but the sky is empty." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: AFsane add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel
